metadata.title: CVE-2020-11931 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An Ubuntu-specific modification to Pulseaudio to provide security mediationfor Snap-packaged applications was found to have a bypass of intendedaccess restriction for snaps which plugs any of pulseaudio, audio-playbackor audio-record via unloading the pulseaudio snap policy module. This issueaffects: pulseaudio 1:8.0 versions prior to 1:8.0-0ubuntu3.12; 1:11.1versions prior to 1:11.1-1ubuntu7.7; 1:13.0 versions prior to1:13.0-1ubuntu1.2; 1:13.99.1 versions prior to 1:13.99.1-1ubuntu3.2;

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-11931` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpulse-mainloop-glib0 - 1:8.0-0ubuntu3.12
libpulse0 - 1:8.0-0ubuntu3.12
libpulsedsp - 1:8.0-0ubuntu3.12
pulseaudio - 1:8.0-0ubuntu3.12
pulseaudio-esound-compat - 1:8.0-0ubuntu3.12
pulseaudio-module-bluetooth - 1:8.0-0ubuntu3.12
pulseaudio-module-droid - 1:8.0-0ubuntu3.12
pulseaudio-module-gconf - 1:8.0-0ubuntu3.12
pulseaudio-module-jack - 1:8.0-0ubuntu3.12
pulseaudio-module-lirc - 1:8.0-0ubuntu3.12
pulseaudio-module-raop - 1:8.0-0ubuntu3.12
pulseaudio-module-trust-store - 1:8.0-0ubuntu3.12
pulseaudio-module-x11 - 1:8.0-0ubuntu3.12
pulseaudio-module-zeroconf - 1:8.0-0ubuntu3.12
pulseaudio-utils - 1:8.0-0ubuntu3.12
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pulseaudio package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:8.0-0ubuntu3.12').
